instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> at 1.1v
threads.message: Hello, I have a board that has 8.18 volts on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and 3.43v but no green light. I checked <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and it is at 1.1v. does this mean the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> is bad? Thanks for any info!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> at 1.1v
threads.message:
First remove <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>.
If <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> goes high to 3.3V, then change <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>.
If still low, remove <RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> and check again the signal.
If high, change <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
If still low, remove/clean J6100.
As the last option, reflow/change SMC.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> is Ok.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> at 1.1v
threads.message: Ok, So I followed your advice all the way up to... Wouldn't you know it? the Freaking JTAG!!!!! Removed it and BAM! Green/Orange light. Put <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> back on and BAM!!! FAN SPIN!!!! I swear I looked at the J6100 and it didn't look bad at first glance, on the outside. but inside some of the pins were pinkish-red. Thank you so much! You Rock!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> at 1.1v
threads.message: In case someone with the same issue as me comes here, I had the same exact issue, <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> at 1.1V I not only followed the above steps but also replaced each component mentioned, board always did the same thing, it will work fine for 1 day then the next day it will be back to not working and <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> at 1.1V or so, I end up replacing <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> with a lower resistance one to compensate for the missing voltage and now the board works every time.
